intro: Scyphostelma velutinum, commonly known as the velvet star, is a unique and rare plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped inflorescence, which gives it its common name. The plant has a hairy, velvety texture on its stems and leaves, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It is native to specific regions in South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Scyphostelma velutinum is considered a valuable and often protected species in botanical conservation efforts.
